subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: The grep example shows how to search a schema for tables and columns matching a regular expression.

ol.li: Follow the instructions in the commandline example.

To find tables with certain column names, run sc.cmd -infolevel=standard -command=schema -procedures= -grepcolumns=.*\.PUBLISHER (or sc.sh -infolevel=standard -command=schema -procedures= -grepcolumns=.*\.PUBLISHER on Unix)

To find stored procedures with certain parameter names, run sc.cmd -c hsqldb -infolevel=standard -command=schema -tables= -grepinout=.*\.B_OFFSET (or sc.sh -c hsqldb -infolevel=standard -command=schema -tables= -grepinout=.*\.B_OFFSET on Unix)
Try grep for columns in tables that match a pattern.
